title: How does it feel to be an author who “peaked” with a popular novel? - Quora

response.answer_text: I wish I knew? I haven’t peaked, nor have I written a popular novel. From my perspective at least, I would think one would have some disappointment finding and then losing success. However, being a writer, that just comes with the territory. Most of us will type until our fingers bleed and our brains are mush, and never write a popular novel, but that doesn’t mean we’re going to stop trying. To be a writer is to put your hopes and dreams, along with your failures and frustrations out there for the world to see. We write to share. We write to be heard. We write for fun. We write for work. My point is, regardless of what life throws at us, we’ll still be at the keyboard the very next day doing the same thing we did the day before. Try to measure success by what you do, rather than what you’ve done.

It’s… disappointing, for awhile. You find yourself saying, “Yeah, that one was fine, but isn’t this one even better?” And the market keeps saying, “Nope.” But after awhile you adjust. That early success is still something you’re proud of, but you recognize it as largely a stroke of luck and you keep going, doing the best you can — and hoping luck will strike again, but not expecting it.
